intro: Myosotis saruwagedica, commonly known as the Saruwageda Forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with cool climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, soft hair, while its stems are slender and often sprawling. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique habitat and limited distribution.
